at.pwd.boardgame.game.mancala

Class MancalaBoard

  • java.lang.Object
    • at.pwd.boardgame.game.mancala.MancalaBoard
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Board

    public class MancalaBoard
extends java.lang.Object
implements Board
    Board for the game Mancala. Keep in mind that this class is not optimized for speed. If your agent needs special optimizations it is recommended to use your own data structure in your own agent. Keep in mind, that there is a clear distinction between slot and depot. A slot is a place that initially contains stones (standard rules say 6) and a depot (=Kalaha) is a place that initially do not have any stones. Each player has multiple slots but only one depot.

    • Method Detail

      • next

        public java.lang.String next(java.lang.String id)
        Returns the next slot/depot given the id. Since the mancala board is cyclic this will always return a valid slot/depot id.
        Parameters:
        id - The current slot/depot id
        Returns:
        The next slot/depot id

      • getStonesPerSlot

        public int getStonesPerSlot()
        Getter for stones per slot
        Returns:
        Returns the amount of stones per slot at the beginning of the game

      • setStonesPerSlot

        public void setStonesPerSlot(int stonesPerSlot)
        Setter for stones per slot. Keep in mind this does not actually alter the slots.
        Parameters:
        stonesPerSlot - Sets the amount of stones per slot at the beginning of the game.

      • isSlot

        public boolean isSlot(java.lang.String id)
        Checks whether the given ID is a valid slot id
        Parameters:
        id - The questioned slot id
        Returns:
        true if it is a slot, false if it is not a slot (does not exist or is a depot)

      • isDepot

        public boolean isDepot(java.lang.String id)
        Checks whether the given ID is a valid depot id
        Parameters:
        id - The questioned slot id
        Returns:
        true if it is a depot, false if it is not a depot (does not exist or is a slot)

      • getEnemySlotOf

        public java.lang.String getEnemySlotOf(java.lang.String id)
        Returns the ID of the enemy slot of the given id
        Parameters:
        id - the ID of the own slot
        Returns:
        the ID of the enemy slot or null if the given id does not exist

      • getDepotOfPlayer

        public java.lang.String getDepotOfPlayer(int playerId)
        Returns the depot id of the given playerId
        Parameters:
        playerId - the given player ID
        Returns:
        returns the depot id or null if the player does not exist
